result.execSummary:
The defendant Divonte M Forbes was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 6.12.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment will be ordered.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 6.12.15 or a civil judgment is ordered.

With credit of 86 days time served, and with Huber Privileges for work, school and childcare.  Court orders the Day Reporting Center.
If the defendant has no rule violations and is accepted by the Day Reporting Center the court orders release on electronic monitoring upon approval.  If the defendant has any rule violations the defendant is to have no release.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Divonte M Forbes

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Divonte M Forbes in court with attorney Jacob Manian.  Defendant Divonte M Forbes in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Defendant ordered to serve 12 months in the House of Correction with credit of 86 days time served, and with Huber Privileges for work, school and childcare.  Court orders the Day Reporting Center.
If the defendant has no rule violations and is accpeted by the Day Reporting Center the court orders release on electronic monitoring upon approval.  If the defendant has any rule violations the defendant is to have no release.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 6.12.15 or, if not paid, a civil judgment will be ordered.
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs by 6.12.15 or a civil judgment is ordered.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 
Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Divonte M Forbes in court with attorney Jacob Manian.  Hanna Ritchie Kolberg appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Motion will be held on trial date.
Defendant's Motion to Suppress Evidence and Brief in Support of Motion to Suppress Evidence.

Attorney Jacob Manian in court, defendant Divonte M Forbes not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Bail motion by defense argued and granted by the Court.    Defense enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND on behalf of the defendant.    Case adjourned for final pretrial on 4.1.15 and for jury trial on 4.13.15.  Motion hearing scheduled for 04-01-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Jacob Manian in court, defendant Divonte M Forbes not in court, in custody.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference and bail bond hearing in Branch 7.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 03-16-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Divonte M Forbes in court with attorney Jacob Manian.  Defendant Divonte M Forbes in custody.  Nichole Shelton for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for February 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: BRYTTANIE F. OR HER RESIDENCE.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Divonte M Forbes in court with attorney Anne A. Devitt.  
Defendant Divonte M Forbes in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
